timeline.bodyText:
Like switching to enum here.
But what if networkType == null..
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
I think  networkType == null condition could be checked when we verify resource of SegmentWebRequestJson. If found networkType == null, we could throw an specific exception.
So I miss networkType == null here.
What do you think?
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: I think it is time for us to use standard REST error code that is compatible to OpenStack.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Okay ~
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText:
@kevin-zhonghao Can you take a look at this commit: https://github.com/futurewei-cloud/alcor/pull/180/files#diff-17bb45b637cbf4c960554c2ae9fe82bc?
Specifically, all the exception classes has an associated error code so when we throw that exception, web layer will throw the associated error code. That is a good pattern to learn.
For example,
services/port_manager/src/main/java/com/futurewei/alcor/portmanager/exception/ReleaseIpAddrBulkException.java
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Thanks for making the change!
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Do we have to use a GetTransaction for every get request? If so, please move the transaction block code to service layer, instead of keeping it in Controller layer.

replies.bodyText: Okay ~ I'll revise it in next update

timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: We only have one range in vlan range
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Please uncomment this. We do need MTU.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Yes, but where can we get mtu? segmentRequestObject doesn't include it
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Response should be "VlanKeyResponse", right?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Yeah ~ althought VlanKeyResponse is same as VlanKeyRequest here
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Either rename the method to GetVlanRange, or change the response type to a more generic name like NetworkSegmentRange etc..
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Okay ~ you are right
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Ideally, the Segment Service could have a generic method name like addEntity(segmentId, segmentationId, networkType) so that it could have different implementation for various network types.

replies.bodyText: Three implementation would look fantastic. why not? :-)
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Should a VlanRange be associated with a segment id?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I see it in the resource that "If there are different tenants and different private networks are created, in order to isolate packets on the data network, you need to specify segmentid when creating the private network"
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: yes but NetworkVlanRange is about the range of Vlan Segmentation Id, right? Let us discuss on these.
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I got the point. Actually the Range entity does not need segment Id, but network type entity does
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Split it to NetworkValanRangeRequest and Response
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Now I make it as NetworkRangeRequest. All network type use the same range request class

replies.bodyText: Cool thanks for making this change.

timeline.bodyText: String "segmentationUuid" or "segmentationUUID"

Thanks for adding all these exceptions!
Do you expect the same exceptions to be used by other services? If those are VPC manager specific, maybe we should move them to VpcManager?

timeline.bodyText: Add POST and DELETE as well.
timeline.author: xieus
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,7 @@
     public RouterFunction<ServerResponse> vpcHandlerRouting(VpcWebHandlers vpcWebHandlers) {
         return
                 route(GET("/project/{projectId}/vpcs/{vpcId}"), vpcWebHandlers::getVpc)
+                        .andRoute(GET("/project/{projectId}/network/{vpcId}"), vpcWebHandlers::getVpc)
                         .andRoute(POST("/project/{projectId}/vpcs").and(accept(APPLICATION_JSON)).and(contentType(APPLICATION_JSON)), vpcWebHandlers::createVpc)

replies.bodyText: NP
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText:
Usually DELETE is the reverse order of POST. Let us do this:
(1) segmentDatabaseService.deleteSegment(segmentid);
(2) segmentService.release VxLan/VLan/Gre entity.
If segmentService tries to release entity first and the process crashes before segmentDatabaseService.deleteSegment, the segmentation Id might be released already so will be allocated to other segment, which causes "one key shared by two segments" issue.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: We might need to visit other Controller in VPC/subnet/Route to see if we hit the same issue elsewhere.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: These comments are really good. Let us try to spread it elsewhere for important Controller and Service methods.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Sure
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText:
There is another service interface called "SegmentService" but it also deals with database access, right? In this case, we should use names that match what it is exactly?
A renaming suggestion:
(1) SegmentDatabaseService  => SegmentManagementService
(2) SegmentService  => SegmentKeyManagementService
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Let's talk about it
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Try not use "println"
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I replace it with log info
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Could you comment the usage of 0 and 4095?
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: I think segmentId should be removed from NetworkVxlanRange as well.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Yeah
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao
